data.title: Hereâ€™s what the Minecraft movie is about
data.meta_description: Warner Bros.â€™ film adaptation of Minecraft finds a new director in Peter Sollett. The plot focuses on a teenage girl and a group of adventurers who must save their beautiful, blocky Overworld.
data.text:
Warner Bros.â€™ Minecraft movie has a new director in Peter Sollett, whose work includes TV series The Path for Hulu and films Freeheld and Nick and Norahâ€™s Infinite Playlist. Sollett replaces Itâ€™s Always Sunny in Philadelphia co-creator Rob McElhenney, who bowed out of the film last year.

Whatâ€™s more interesting than a new director for the Minecraft movie â€” which, if weâ€™re going by a dozen or so other video game film adaptation attempts, is likely to never reach theaters â€” is the filmâ€™s reported plot. According to Variety, the Minecraft movie will tell the story of â€œa teenage girl and her unlikely group of adventurers who, after the malevolent Ender Dragon sets out on a path of destruction, must save their beautiful, blocky Overworld.â€

That story synopsis appears to come courtesy of writers Aaron and Adam Nee, who were tapped to write the Minecraft movie script when McElhenney quit the project. McElhenney worked on a previous version of the story with writer Jason Fuchs, who helped pen the scripts for Wonder Woman and Ice Age: Continental Drift.

Warner Bros. and Mojang have been working on a Minecraft movie in some form since early 2014. The companiesâ€™ first attempt involved director Shawn Levy (Night at the Museum, Stranger Things) who proposed a Goonies-style adventure set in the world of Minecraft. McElhenney joined the project in 2015 with an expectation of a 2019 theatrical release.
